author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Kamala Harris picks at his inferiority complex': Pres. Trump ramps up racist and sexist attacks against historic Vice Presidential nominee
description: President Trump is making a last-ditch effort to scare suburban women into voting for him using outdated and racists tropes similar to the attacks he’s aiming at Senator Kamala Harris, the first woman of color to be nominated for Vice President on a major par…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'We can’t be what we can’t see': Latinas running for Congressional seats talk representation in leadership
description: This year, women are on pace to set more records in Congress. In 2018, 102 women won their House races, and as of this week, 243 women have won house primaries. According to the Center for American Women and Politics, a record 75 Latinas are major-party Congr…
source.name: MSNBC

title: President Trump’s younger brother Robert dies in New York hospital
description: President Trump's younger brother, Robert, has died while staying at at New York City hospital. The White House did not disclose what the cause of his death was.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Memo to Trump: 'Up against Kamala Harris, you are right to be afraid'
description: Rev. Al Sharpton reminds the president of his cowardice when confronted by women with power. Democratic vice-presidential pick Kamala Harris has stood tall amid both racial and misogynistic attacks from the president.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Experts: Don't underestimate election disinformation impact
description: Russia interference in the 2020 U.S. election is still impacting voters, experts Ashley Bryant and Andre Banks of A/B Partners explain. They elaborate on how to fight online election disinformation from Russia and beyond with Tiffany Cross on AM JOY on MSNBC.
source.name: MSNBC

title: House Oversight Committee calls on Postmaster General Louis Dejoy to testify
description: Rep. Rashida Tlaib joins AMJoy to discuss the House Oversight Committee calling on Postmaster General Louis Dejoy to testify at an urgent hearing about the crisis at the United States Postal Service on August 24.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Lynch: American people must focus on securing fair, free election
description: Voter turnout, protecting the 2020 elections, backlash to the Black Lives Matter movement, as well as its widespread support, are discussed by former Attorney General Lorretta Lynch, who joins Tiffany Cross on AM JOY on MSNBC.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Booker: We must redouble efforts to get out the vote
description: The Democratic National Convention and the importance of voter turnout are discussed by Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ), who tells Tiffany Cross, ‘We should be redoubling our efforts to make sure we get out the vote.’
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Senate candidate M.J. Hegar: ‘The Post Office was a lifeline when I was deployed’
description: Democratic Congressional candidates M.J. Hegar of Texas and Jaime Harrison of South Carolina discuss Trump’s attacks on the Post Office, Kamala Harris’ historic nomination, and the fight to flip red seats in the Senate.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Bernie Sanders: ‘Trump is the most dangerous president in American history’
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont says his long-term goal after electing Biden is to “rally the American people around the progressive agenda.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Errin Haines: Trump is ‘weaponizing white womanhood’ to divide the female vote
description: Errin Haines, editor-at-large of The 19th, and Nikole Hannah-Jones, Pulitzer Prize-winning creator of the New York Times’ 1619 Project, discuss Black women’s exclusion from the suffrage movement and how politicians like Trump appeal to white women.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: Election Day should be a national holiday
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi argues the U.S. should improve its record of low voter turnout by making it easier to get to the polls.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NBC/WSJ poll: Biden leads Trump nationally by nine points on eve of conventions
description: A new NBC/WSJ poll shows Joe Biden leading President Trump by nine points among registered voters on the eve of the Democratic National Convention.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: St. Rep. Ruth Buffalo: Tribal community votes being suppressed
description: Native American voters need greater inclusion in the ranks and outreach of the Democratic Party, and greater help addressing the suppression of the indigineous vote, St. Rep. Ruth Buffalo of Nevada tells Tiffany Cross on AM JOY on MSNBC.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Brown: Young voters of color want identity policies not politics
description: Voter turnout among young people of color is analyzed by expert LaTosha Brown, who asserts that, ‘Younger voters are not so interested and moved by just the candidates or identity politics. They want identity policies.’
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Meng: API voters can make difference in battleground states
description: Voters in the API community can help Democrats win in battleground states Rep. Meng says, as she urges Democrats to invest more in long term relationships with API voters and organizations. Meng joins Tiffany Cross on AM JOY on MSNBC to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Voto Latino CEO on getting more Latinx voters registered to vote
description: Voters in the Latinx community need better outreach from the Democratic Party, expert Maria Teresa Kumar, CEO of Voto Latino, tells Tiffany Cross on AM JOY on MSNBC.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Tiffany apologizes to Errin Haines in fun on-air name check
description: MSNBC guest host Tiffany Cross has a fun moment with MSNBC contributor Errin Haines, as Cross corrects her misnaming of Haines in a fun, on-air name correction.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Candidate for Congress Williams runs to sustain John Lewis legacy
description: John Lewis’ legacy endures in candidate for Congress Nikema Williams, who is not only running to replace the late, great Civil Rights icon in the U.S. House of Representatives; Williams also pledges to push for the John Lewis Voting Rights Act to be passed as…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Making the case for Latino voter support at the DNC
description: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris will make their appeal to voters at the Democratic National Convention this week, and while much emphasis will be placed on stirring up enthusiasm among party loyalists, they will also be making the case to those Democratic voters …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Tuesday marks 100 years since women were given the right to vote
description: August 18th marks 100 years since the 19th amendment was ratified giving women the right to vote. But for women of color it took years after that day to gain the ability to freely vote. Unpacking the legacy of what 100 years of voting for women truly means, T…
source.name: MSNBC
